subject: BMC:  Fan control for Idle Power saver
commitMessage:
BMC:  Fan control for Idle Power saver

Read IPS active from sysfs and push onto dBus IPS properties
Tested: enable/disable IPS on WEB, occ instrospect ips
Signed-off-by: Sheldon Bailey <baileysh@us.ibm.com>

the other addWatches have try/catches around them... does this need one too?
I do not believe so,, and not all of them do.
I think I'm blind.  what code did you add that uses this?
oh nevermind, it was in a newer patch set.
same here, what code did add that uses this?

because powermode is derived from this interface class, you can just do:
active(false);
you can read the property value with active(), so not sure you need this?
so still work to do here?
Yes.. I thought I got this in a not review state,,, ???
i don't follow why you're doing this?
what ascii number are you looking for?  "2"?
you can just have data be a char and do if (data == '2')
fyi there's a helper library called sdeventplus that provides C++ APIs for all of the event stuff but since this code was already using the C calls this is fine.
ok,, this api is also in occ_error.cpp

can remove

also just FYI internal failure PELs are always informational
as I mentioned before, can just do == '2'

The answer back could be 3 as well, so I chose a mathmatical approach
I am looking to get back These values:
49-48=1  1&2=0   0>> = 0 or false
50-48=2  2&2=2   2>> = 1 or true
51-48=3  3&2=2   2>> = 1 or true
                 |--------from this 2 I could do ==2
so all I would have to do is just call active(newState);

at least add a comment that says that this should only ever be a 2 or a 3 and not a 6 or a 7.

I'll defer to Eddie if this is safe to do based on what the driver could return
Driver will directly return ips status field as string representing an integer (though stored as a u8 in the driver). So this looks fine to me.
